intro: Nallogia gaudichaudiana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Nallogia gaudichaudiana has been traditionally used by Māori for its strong, fibrous leaves, which were woven into baskets and other crafts.
